item.title: U.S. launches huge show of force in Persian Gulf, sending message to Iran - Int'l Herald Tribune
item.description: U.S. warplanes screamed off the deck of two aircraft carriers in the Persian Gulf Tuesday in a massive show of force that military officials said was intended to send a message to Iran.

item.title: Oil spikes $5 on rumors of Iran attack - CNN Money
item.description: U.S. crude futures briefly spiked over $5 a barrel in electronic trading late Tuesday on rumors that Iran fired on U.S. Navy warships.

item.title: Germany Vows EU Constitution By June - All Headline News
item.description: German Chancellor Angela Merkel on Sunday pledged to have a "roadmap" for the much-delayed European Union constitution by the end of June. Merkel made the pronouncement as she said there was a strong consensus among the 27 EU member-states that a decision on the constitution is reached before Germany's presidency ends in June 30.

item.title: Youths clash with riot police at Paris' Gare du Nord station - CNN
item.description: Riot police firing tear gas and brandishing batons clashed Tuesday with bands of youths who shattered windows and looted shops at a major Paris train station, officials said. Nine people were arrested.

item.title: UK ready to produce Iran evidence - BBC
item.description: The government is preparing to release photographic evidence to support its assertion that 15 UK sailors seized by Iran were not in Iranian waters.
